channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Signs can come down now, 27th July
item.description:
All the no parking notices have been vandalised and are now out of date. Thanks in advance for sorting this out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Robert Burns Avenue, Benhall, Cheltenham

item.title: 2 x large holes in carriage way, 27th July
item.description:
The 2 x potholes have been there for at least a couple of months. They are equal distance between each other in correlation to vehicle wheels!

item.title: Flytipped mower, 25th July
item.description:
Someone has dumped this mower on Milton Rd, near the junction with Byron Rd. It looks like it could be repaired or, at worst, reclaimed for scrap and electrical waste.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Byron Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham

item.title: Railings along path damaged, 25th July
item.description:
The railings either side of the footpath between the two pedestrian crossings on the A40 before the roundabout have been smashed (presumably by a recent vehicle collision) and are lying twisted and damaged on the ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Benhall, Cheltenham

item.title: Is this vehicle abandoned?, 22nd July
item.description:
The vehicle has been here for a couple of weeks. It maybe untaxed and have no MOT but hasnâ€™t been SORNed. There are a number of elderly people nearby that now have at least one less parking space for their convenience.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairhaven Avenue, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New road markings causing a safety hazard, 22nd July
item.description:
New Road markings have been added to the road as part of the new parking scheme. This has resulted in creating a dangerous bottle neck, obscuring visibility on cars turning in / out of side roads. I witness a number of near misses yesterday. These changes are dangerous to road users and need to be reversed immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red button light on pelican crossing not working, 21st July
item.description:
The light to indicate the pedestrian button has been pressed has not been working on the north west side for a year or so. I appreciate that this does not stop the lights from changing, however, since this is heavily used by local primary school, it would be helpful if this was working correctly to help teach the children road safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Sheldons Court, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signage for primary school facing wrong way, 21st July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairview Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
